subject: Re: [junit] Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: ... Yes, in the same package structure as it is in the junit.jar file, specifically: /junit/runner/excluded.properties ... If by mounted you mean added it to
messageBody:
parul_49 wrote:

>I have another question,
>I read on the FAQ's site for Junit, saying that if you get a linkage
>error, change the excluded.properties file, to include other
>packages, and place that in ur classpath before the junit.jar.
>

Yes, in the same package structure as it is in the junit.jar file,
specifically:

/junit/runner/excluded.properties


>
>What I have done is that I modified the excluded.properties and
>added/replaced it in the junit.jar and mounted it.
>Is that the same thing, or will it not work?
>

If by "mounted" you mean added it to the classpath used by NetBeans or
whatever, then I suppose so.

>
>I tried using the swingui, but it gives me all kinds of exceptions. I
>know my tests run thru' the textui, but it gives a classCastException
>and a null ptr exception.
>would anyone know why?
>

I suspect your changed excluded.properties file isn't in play. Perhaps
it's not in the correct package.

>
>Also I am using net Beans, so when u say that put it in your
>classpath before the junit.jar does that mean mount it before you
>mount the junit.jar.
>

It means the classpath order defines your fully-qualified
excluded.properties file before the default one. If "mounting" gets you
there, then so be it.

Mike
